TopicTitle: Soyuz rocket fails to reach orbit

Articles.Content:
A Soyuz rocket and a Russian military communications satellite crashed in Siberia on Friday, continuing a pesky series of launch mishaps blemishing Russia\'s space program in the last year.

http://www.spaceflightnow.com/news/n1112/23soyuzmeridian/

The third stage crapped out, again.

According to the BBC, the satellite ended up hitting someone\'s house;

The owner of the house, Andrei Krivoruchenko, said that he heard a huge noise and a crash as the satellite hit the roof.

'I climbed up onto the roof and could not work out what had happened. Then I saw a huge hole in the roof and the metal object,' he told Russian state television.

Cording to the BBC, the satellite ended up hitting someone\'s house;

LOLWUT?

They need to download a new third stage engine or something, they\'re probably using the default ones. Lets tell them to get the KW pack.

Either that or they just need more boosters on the sides...

According to the BBC, the satellite ended up hitting someone\'s house;

If an entire third stage, with propellant still inside hit someones house, there wouldn\'t be a hole in the roof. There would be no house left.

Perhaps some breakaway debris?

If an entire third stage, with propellant still inside hit someones house, there wouldn\'t be a hole in the roof. There would be no house left.

Perhaps some breakaway debris?

The satellite separated from the third stage and then smashed through the house, I think.

The satellite separated from the third stage and then smashed through the house, I think.

So the controllers panicked when it shut down because they left it on full throttle and it overheated, and hit the space bar?

Again? Oh russia...

In Soviet Russia, Progress lets down Soyuz...
Soyuz: making Progress one failure at a time.

Soyuz: making Progress one failure at a time.

Very funny, tell that to their insurance company...
